page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: Almost 3/4 of the area covered lies east of the{A 286}road leading towards London through Midhurst (southwards) and Haslemere (northwards). The road climbs from 39 feet in the south to 150 feet in the north. The whole area is mainly{farming land, {common land}and stretches of{woodland. The land east of the road climbs gently at first and then rises steeply to{Bexleyhill}in the north-east. {King Edward VII Hospital}is approached eastwards from the A 286. {Budgenor Lodge}is on the east side of the road in the very south of the area.
